{"step_by_step_thinking": "Celiac disease is a chronic autoimmune disorder that is triggered by the ingestion of gluten in genetically predisposed individuals. The treatment of celiac disease is a strict lifelong gluten-free diet, which leads to resolution of the diarrhea, often within days. However, in severe cases, diarrhea and malabsorption may persist for a time even after starting a gluten-free diet. In such cases, the use of anti-diarrheal agents such as diphenoxylate can be beneficial. Avoiding all dairy products or restricting soy products is not necessary unless the patient has a known intolerance. Prednisone is a steroid and is not typically used for the treatment of diarrhea.", "answer_choice": "B. Diphenoxylate"}
